phaseBanner.text: This is a new service – your feedback will help us to improve it.

end.heading: End of prototype
end.description: You've reached the end of this prototype. Return to the homepage to try another journey

checkYourDetails.heading: We need to check your details
checkYourDetails.paragraph1: Your details will be checked against information held by another organisation.
checkYourDetails.paragraph2: This will help us protect you against online identity theft.

additionalDetails.summaryText: Who we check your details with
additionalDetails.text:
We’ll check your details with Experian (opens in new tab). This is because companies like Experian have access to information about interactions you’ve previously had with other organisations.

Read our privacy notice (opens in a new tab) if you’d like to know more about how your details will be used to prove your identity.

confirmDetails.heading: Confirm your details
confirmDetails.warning: Make sure your details are correct before you continue. You will not be able to change them later.

summaryList.key2: Year you started living at this address

confirmDetails.buttonText: I confirm my details are correct

enterAddress.heading: Enter your address
enterAddress.yearQuestion: When did you start living here?
enterAddress.yearQuestionHint: Enter the year you started living at this address, for example 2017

enterPassport.heading: Enter your details exactly as they appear on your UK passport
enterPassport.paragraph1: Your passport contains a lot of information that we can check to make sure that you are who you say you are.
enterPassport.paragraph2: We’ll check your details with the HM Passport Office to make sure your passport has not been cancelled or reported as lost or stolen.

passportNumberInput.hint: This is the 9 digit number in the top right hand corner of the photo page in your passport
passportNumberInput.label: Passport number

middleNameInput.label: Middle names
middleNameInput.hint: You do not have to fill this in if you do not have any middle names

findAddress.heading: Find your address
findAddress.inputHint: Enter the postcode of your current home address. This must be a UK postcode, for example SW1A 2AA.

chooseAddress.heading: Choose your address
chooseAddress.selectLabel: Choose your current home address from the list:
chooseAddress.noAddressLink: I cannot find my address in the list

proveIdentity.heading: Prove your identity
proveIdentity.paragraph2: We’ll ask for your current address and passport details.
proveIdentity.paragraph3: We’ll also ask you some security questions only you will know the answer to. You might find it easier to answer these questions if you have information about:
proveIdentity.paragraph4: You’ll be able to save your proof of identity to your GOV.UK account.
proveIdentity.listItem3: any credit cards, loans or morgages you may have

proveIdentityLoggedOut.heading: Prove your identity to continue
proveIdentityLoggedOut.paragraph: You need to prove your identity before you can [doThing].
proveIdentityLoggedOut.optionsLegend: How would you like to prove your identity?

optionOne.text: Prove your identity online using a GOV.UK account
optionOne.hint: You’ll be asked to create a GOV.UK account if you do not have one

optionTwo.text: Take your identity documents to be checked in person

proveIdentityLoggedOut.paragraph4: You’ll be able to save your proof of identity to your GOV.UK account.
proveIdentityLoggedOut.listItem3: any credit cards, loans or morgages you may have

save.heading: You’ve successfully proved your identity
save.paragraph: You can save your proof of identity to your GOV.UK account so you can skip these questions next time a service needs to check who you are.
save.paragraph2: You’ll be able to see or delete your proof of identity at any time in your GOV.UK account.
save.buttonText: Save proof of identity to your GOV.UK account
save.linkText: Do not save proof of identity and continue to [service]

saved.heading: You’ve saved your proof of identity to your GOV.UK account
saved.paragraph1: This means you can skip the identity questions next time a service needs to check who you are.
saved.paragraph2: You can sign in to your GOV.UK account to see or delete your proof of identity at any time.

additionalDetails.summaryText: If you do not want to continue now
additionalDetails.text: You can [doThing] later. You’ll be asked to sign to to your GOV.UK account and use your saved proof of identity to continue.

answerSecurityQuestions.heading: Answer security questions
answerSecurityQuestions.paragraph1: We’ll ask you some security questions that only you should know the answers to. This will help us stop anyone else who might have your details from pretending to be you.
answerSecurityQuestions.paragraph2: The questions will be about things like your mobile phone contract, bank account, and any credit cards, loans or mortgages you have.
answerSecurityQuestions.paragraph3: We will not keep your answers.
answerSecurityQuestions.warning: Try to answer these questions as accurately as you can. You will not be able to change the answers if you make a mistake

questionOne.heading: How much did you borrow when you first took out your mortgage?
questionOne.hint: You can find this amount on your offer letter or mortgage agreement

questionTwo.heading: When did you take out your mobile phone contract?
questionTwo.hint: Think about when you took out your personal mobile phone contract instead of your work phone, if you have one.

questionThree.heading: When did you open your current account?
questionThree.hint: Think about your current account only. This does not include any joint, business or savings accounts you might have.

questionFour.heading: How much of your loan do you pay back every month?
questionFour.hint: Think about the amount you agreed to pay back every month on a personal loan. This does not include hire purchase agreements, second mortgages, home credit loans or student loans. You can find this amount on your loan agreement.

useSavedIdentity.heading: Use your saved proof of identity to continue
useSavedIdentity.paragraph1: You need to prove your identity before you [doThing].
useSavedIdentity.paragraph2: Your GOV.UK account will check your saved proof of identity to confirm it’s really you.

checkInPerson.heading: Check your identity in person
checkInPerson.paragraph1: Here is how you can do an Idenitity check in person...

activity.title: Account activity
activity.contactUs: If you see something you do not recognise, contact us.

home.title: Your GOV.UK account
home.servicesHeading: Services you sign in to with your GOV.UK account
home.usesSavedIdentityParagraph: This service uses your saved proof of identity

aboutAccounts.heading: About GOV.UK accounts
aboutAccounts.paragraph1: GOV.UK accounts are new. At the moment you can only use your GOV.UK account with a few services.
aboutAccounts.paragraph2: GOV.UK accounts are currently separate from other government accounts (for example Government Gateway or Universal Credit).
aboutAccounts.paragraph3: In the future, you’ll be able to use your GOV.UK account to sign in to most services on GOV.UK.

yourProofOfId.heading: Your proof of identity
yourProofOfId.link: See or delete your saved proof of identity
yourProofOfId.haveSavedInfo: You’ve saved your proof of identity to your account. Your account will check it each time a service needs to confirm who you are.
yourProofOfId.haveNotSavedInfo1: There’s no proof of identity information saved to your GOV.UK account.
yourProofOfId.haveNotSavedInfo2: You’ll be able to prove your identity and save it next time you use a service that needs to check who you are.

settings.title: GOV.UK account settings

yourAccountActivity.heading: View your account activity
yourAccountActivity.info: See when you’ve signed in and how your account has used your saved information.

deleteAccount.heading: Delete your GOV.UK account
deleteAccount.info: This will permanently delete your GOV.UK account. You’ll no longer be able to sign in to the services you’ve used with your account.

settings.deletedProofOfIdSuccess: You’ve deleted your proof of identity

yourProofOfId.title: Your proof of identity
yourProofOfId.paragraph1: Your GOV.UK account proves your identity with information you’ve provided.
yourProofOfId.paragraph2: Your account checks this information to prove your identity every time you use a service that requires it.
yourProofOfId.summaryListTitle: Information you’ve provided to prove your identity
yourProofOfId.deleteInformationLink: Delete your identity information from your account
yourProofOfId.paragraph3: You may need to answer some more identity  questions next time if:
yourProofOfId.listItem1: your saved information is out of date
yourProofOfId.listItem2: a service needs extra information to check who you are, for security reasons
yourProofOfId.servicesUsingIdHeading: How you’ve used your saved proof of identity
yourProofOfId.servicesUsingIdParagraph: Your GOV.UK account has confirmed your identity to the following services.
yourProofOfId.yourAccountActivityLink: You can view all of your account activity.

noSavedIdentity.heading: You do not currently have saved identity credentials
noSavedIdentity.paragraph1: You will need to do a full identity check next time you use a relevant government service. Or you can do them now to save time later

deleteProofOfId.title: Delete the information you use to prove your identity
deleteProofOfId.paragraph1: Confirm you want to permanently delete the information your GOV.UK account uses to prove your identity. This will not delete your account.
deleteProofOfId.paragraph2: You will need to go through the process of proving your identity next time you use a service that requires it.

accessManagement.title: Access Management
accessManagement.hint: This will authorise information moving around

requestBasicCheck.title: Request a basic DBS check
requestBasicCheck.paragraph1: Apply for a basic Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check to get a copy of your criminal record. This is called ‘basic disclosure’. It costs £23. It’s available for people working in England and Wales.
requestBasicCheck.insetText1: This page is also available in Welsh (Cymraeg).
requestBasicCheck.paragraph2: You can also get a basic DBS check if you live in Northern Ireland or Scotland but the job you’re applying for is in England or Wales.
requestBasicCheck.insetText2: There’s a different way to apply if you’re applying for a job in Northern Ireland or Scotland
requestBasicCheck.paragraph3: The check will only show convictions that are not ‘spent’, for example some types of caution will disappear after 3 months.
requestBasicCheck.paragraph4: You must be 16 or over to apply.
requestBasicCheck.paragraph5: It usually takes up to 14 days for you to receive your certificate.
requestBasicCheck.paragraph6: You might need to create an account and prove your identity before you can apply for a basic DBS check.
requestBasicCheck.listItem1: all your addresses for the last 5 years and the dates you lived there
requestBasicCheck.paragraph8: The service is available from 8am to 11:30pm.
requestBasicCheck.paragraph9: Make sure a basic <abbr title="Disclosure and Barring Service">DBS</abbr> check is the correct one for you. For certain roles, your employer may need to apply for a higher level of criminal record check.
requestBasicCheck.paragraph10: Find out if you need a basic DBS check or ask your employer if you’re not sure.
requestBasicCheck.paragraph11: You can pay for a basic <abbr title="Disclosure and Barring Service">DBS</abbr> check yourself or you can get someone to pay for you - for example, an employer or relative.
requestBasicCheck.paragraph12: You can pay with a debit or credit card. You can also use Google Pay or Apple Pay.
requestBasicCheck.paragraph13: If you pay the fee yourself, you need to pay it when you apply.
requestBasicCheck.paragraph14: If someone else pays, they must pay the fee within 10 days of your application being submitted.
requestBasicCheck.heading5: Get help to use the online service
requestBasicCheck.paragraph15: If you need support to apply online, call the DBS helpline on 03000 200 190 and select option 2 and then option 1.
requestBasicCheck.paragraph16: You can also choose to apply through other companies. DBS has a list of companies you can apply through.
requestBasicCheck.paragraph17: You’ll need to request a police record instead if:
requestBasicCheck.listItem6: you want to see your police file without receiving a certificate - this will show up any warnings or cautions that are not on your official criminal record
requestBasicCheck.paragraph18: Contact the DBS transgender applications team if you’re a transgender applicant and you do not want to reveal details of your previous identity to a potential employer.
requestBasicCheck.paragraph20:
sensitive@dbs.gov.uk
Telephone: 0151 676 1452
Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm
Find out about call charges

proveYourIdentity.title: Prove your identity to continue
proveYourIdentity.paragraph1: You need to prove your identity before you can continue. You‘ll need an account to do this.
proveYourIdentity.paragraph2: This will help protect you against online identity theft.
proveYourIdentity.agree: By continuing, I agree that I have read and understood the basic DBS check online application privacy policy (opens in a new tab). I understand how the DBS will process my personal data when I'm applying online, before my application has been submitted

applyForBasicCheck.title: Apply for a basic DBS check
applyForBasicCheck.paragraph2: You will be asked to provide personal information, such as:
applyForBasicCheck.listItem1: all your addresses for the last 5 years and the dates you lived there
applyForBasicCheck.listItem3: your driving licence (if you have one)
applyForBasicCheck.paragraph3: Some of the information you provided as part of proving your identity may be reused so you do not have to give the same details again
applyForBasicCheck.agree: By continuing, you agree that you have read and understood the basic DBS check privacy policy (opens in a new tab). I understand how the DBS will process my personal data when I'm applying online, before my application has been submitted

otherNames.title: Have you ever been known by any other names?
otherNames.paragraph1: You must tell us about all other names you’ve used, including middle names.
otherNames.paragraph2: For example, you may have changed your name through marriage or deed poll.
otherNames.insetText: Only your current name will be displayed on your online result.
otherNames.name: Name

whatIsYourSex.title: What is your sex?
whatIsYourSex.hint: We need to know your sex so we can check police records

additionalDetails.summaryText: What personal details will appear on my certificate?
additionalDetails.text:
Your sex will be printed on your paper certificate. However, it will not be displayed on your online result.

If you're transgender or non-binary and are concerned about completing this application, you can read our guidance on transgender applications. You can contact the DBS sensitive transactions team if you do not want to reveal details of your previous identity on your paper certificate.

nino.title: Do you have a UK National Insurance number?
nino.hint: If you can't provide a UK National Insurance number you can still carry on with your application, but it might take us longer to process your check.
nino.radioLabel2: No/I cannot provide the details right now

additionalDetails.summaryText: I don‘t know my UK National Insurance number
additionalDetails.text:
You can find your National Insurance number on your payslip or letters about tax pensions or benefits.

Or you can find out how to apply for a National Insurance number. You can apply once you‘re in the UK.

drivingLicence.title: Do you have a current UK driving licence?
drivingLicence.paragraph: If you can‘t provide driving licence details you can still carry on with your application, but it might take us longer to process your check.
drivingLicence.insetText: The driving licence you provide can be any current full or provisional driving licence (photocard or paper).
drivingLicence.radioLabel2: No/I cannot provide the details right now

additionalDetails.summaryText: I don't know my driving licence number
additionalDetails.text: Your driving licence number is in section 5 of your driving licence photocard.

certificateAddressWhere.title: Where would you like us to send your certificate?
certificateAddressWhere.paragraph1: We can send your certificate to your current address, another personal address (for example a family member), or your employer.
certificateAddressWhere.paragraph2: If you send your certificate to another address make sure you are able to check the information on it is correct.
certificateAddressWhere.insetText: If you send your certificate to a non-UK address it could take longer to arrive in the post.

emailAddress.title: What is your email address?
emailAddress.paragraph1: The email address you provide should be your personal one. If for example, you provide a shared email address, others may be able to view the result of your check.
emailAddress.insetText: You will not be able to view your result online if your check reveals a criminal record.
emailAddress.paragraph2: We'll use your email address to:
emailAddress.listItem1: send you general information about your application
emailAddress.listItem2: send you links to track, view and share your result online

mobileNumber.title: Can we send you text messages about your application and codes to view your result online?
mobileNumber.paragraph: We'll only use your mobile number to:
mobileNumber.listItem1: send you progress updates about your application
mobileNumber.listItem2: send you a security code to let you view your result online
mobileNumber.inputLabel1: Which country is your mobile number registered in?
mobileNumber.inputLabel2: What is your mobile number without the country code?
mobileNumber.warning: If you do not provide a mobile number, you will not be able to view your result online.

whoIsPaying.title: Who is paying for your check?
whoIsPaying.radioHint1: Payment is due as soon as your application is complete. You can pay with a debit or credit card. Google Pay or Apple Pay can also be used.
whoIsPaying.radioLabel2: Someone else is (for example, an employer)
whoIsPaying.radioHint2: We will send you a payment link by email, which you can forward to someone to pay on your behalf, or you can use yourself.

checkYourDetails.title: Check your details
checkYourDetails.paragraph1: Please check your mobile number and email address are correct.
checkYourDetails.paragraph2: You will need a correct mobile to receive updates about the progress of your application and to receive a code that enables you to view your certificate online.
checkYourDetails.paragraph3: You can complete payment at the end of this online application.
checkYourDetails.mobile: Mobile number to send text updates to

disclaimer.title: By continuing with your application you confirm that:
disclaimer.listItem1: the information you've given is true
disclaimer.warning: You could be prosecuted if you knowingly give false information in your application
disclaimer.agree: I agree to the <a href="https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/terms-and-conditions-for-dbs-online-services" class="govuk-link">terms and conditions

signInOrSetUp.title: Personal tax account: sign in or set up
signInOrSetUp.paragraph1: Use your personal tax account to check your records and manage your details with HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC).
signInOrSetUp.paragraph2: This service is also available in Welsh (Cymraeg).
signInOrSetUp.insetText: There’s a different service to file your Self Assessment tax return or report and pay Capital Gains Tax on UK property.
signInOrSetUp.paragraph3: To use personal tax account, you’ll need to prove your identity with a GOV.UK account. If you do not have a GOV.UK account you’l be able to create one.
signInOrSetUp.paragraph4: You can use your personal tax account to:
signInOrSetUp.listItem1: check your Income Tax estimate and tax code
signInOrSetUp.listItem2: fill in, send and view a personal tax return
signInOrSetUp.listItem4: check your income from work in the previous 5 years
signInOrSetUp.listItem5: check how much Income Tax you paid in the previous 5 years
signInOrSetUp.listItem6: check and manage your tax credits
signInOrSetUp.listItem8: track tax forms that you’ve submitted online
signInOrSetUp.listItem9: check or update your Marriage Allowance
signInOrSetUp.listItem10: tell HMRC about a change of name or address
signInOrSetUp.listItem11: check or update benefits you get from work, for example company car details and medical insurance

section1.title: Income
section1.paragraph1: Check or update the employment, pension or other income intormation used to work out your PAYE Income Tax and tax codes.
section1.paragraph2: You have a National Insurance number to make sure your National Insurance contributions and tax are recorded against your name only.
section1.paragraph3: You cannot use this service. You may not be enrolled using Self Assessment, or you may have enrolled with another account.

section2.title: Benefits
section2.paragraph1: View your next payments and the people on your claim, and make changes to your claim.
section2.paragraph2: A tax-free payment to help parents with the cost of brining up children.
section2.paragraph3: Transfer part of your Personal Allowance to your partner so they pay less tax.

section3.title: Pensions
section3.paragraph1: View your State Pension and National Insurance contributions.

enterYourNumber.title: Enter your National Insurance number
enterYourNumber.description: We'll use this to match your National Insurance number to your proved identity.

weveVerifiedYourNumber.title: We've verified your National Insurance number
weveVerifiedYourNumber.paragraph1: We've matched the National Insurance number you've provided to your proved identity.
weveVerifiedYourNumber.paragraph2: You can save your verified National Insurance number to your GOV.UK account. This will save you time when you use any service that needs your National Insurance number.
weveVerifiedYourNumber.continueWithoutSaving: Or do not save and continue to personal tax account

youveSavedYourNumber.title: You've saved your National Insurance number to your GOV.UK account
